job_description: QA Engineer - job post Mindtree (part of Larsen and Toubro (L&T)) 1,256 reviews Austin, TX $50 - $53 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $50 - $53 an hour Job Type Contract Field Diagnostic Tools & Systems Engineering - Diagnostics Software QA Engineer Job Summary Cares Field Diagnostics Tools & Systems Engineering team is seeking candidates with solid Software Quality Assurance experience to assist with validation of Mac and iOS diagnostic tools used in field service channels to support customers and drive key performance metrics. Key Qualifications 5+ years of software-based QA experience or a related field. Working knowledge of UNIX-based systems and command-line tools for log collection and analysis Proven knowledge of core QA methodologies, including creation of test plans and test cases, authoring documentation, problem isolation techniques, regression testing, ad hoc testing, and systems integration testing Advanced familiarity with operating and troubleshooting hardware and software (iOS, macOS, and associated hardware) Proven ability to deliver high-quality work on tight timelines Self-motivated, independent, and proactive Outstanding collaboration skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proven ability to accurately collect and track testing data, and to assist developers and project leads in gauging project impact Description Create and execute systematic, end-to-end test plans and test cases by working with developers and interpreting functional specification documents Use bug-tracking software to report and prioritize issues; work with developers and team leads to understand and pursue issues to resolution Provide project managers and team leads with timely and accurate QA status during various project phases Collaborate with and provide support to developers, product readiness, localization, and other cross-functional teams Contribute to initiatives to improve the overall QA process, such as identifying and closing gaps in testing coverage or inefficiencies in workflows Additional Requirements Experience operating hardware test fixtures is beneficial Experience with testing automation software and scripting development on macOS and iOS platforms is a plus Education Bachelors degree and 5+ years of related experience, or equivalent work experience. Job Type: Contract Salary: $50.00 - $53.00 per hour Experience level: 4 years Schedule: 8 hour shift Experience: Hardware: 5 years (Preferred) QA: 5 years (Preferred) Test automation: 5 years (Preferred) Work Location: On the road If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Remote QA Test Automation Engineer - job post ClientSolv Technologies 4 reviews Austin, TX • Remote $115,000 a year -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $115,000 a year Job Type Contract Company Description ClientSolv Technologies is an IT solution firm with over a decade of experience serving Fortune 1000 companies, public sector and small to medium sized companies. ClientSolv Technologies is a woman-owned and operated company that is certified as a WMBE, 8a firm by the Federal government's Small Business Administration. Job Description We are seeking a QA Test Automation Engineer for a contract-to-hire role. This contract role can work remotely anywhere within the U.S. Due to the nature of projects supported, this role will require U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Residency (Green Card). This role will pay between $50-$60 per hour W2 during the contract duration and $115,000 per year upon permanent/ full time conversion. This role will be working with an Agile development team as a primary contributor to the development, integration, and deployment of automated system tests, ensuring quality, reliability, usability, and performance of new features. automating test execution and evaluating results. The responsibilities of this role are as follows: Plan, estimate, design and develop automation test scripts based on existing framework and enhance where needed. Identify and prepare test data for testing Provide regular updates to the Test/Project Manager Maintain Project’s test and automation artifacts While this role is focused on Automation, this role may require some level of manual testing if needed Qualifications Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in information technology, computer science, statistics, or a related field. Solid hands-on experience in Se/Python or Se/Java building automated test scripts and enhancing framework for efficiency and reusability used in automating test case library of thousands of test cases. Strong coding in Python is a must for test automation. (Strong Java will be considered but will need to learn Python) Understanding OOPs concepts to build reusable and maintainable automation scripts. Proficient in Rest components/APIs for testing webservices and web applications Hands-on experience writing SQL queries for validations and test data prep Experience with testing applications hosted in the AWS environment, thus solid understanding of AWS ecosystem Must have worked in a DevOps environment supporting CI/CD Familiar with testing applications built using Microservices Architecture Familiar with containerization and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes/AWS Fargate Skills required: Programming Scripting Language: Java and/or Python (8 years hands-on experience) Automation skills in Selenium (8 years hands-on experience) SQL skills (8 years hands-on experience) Rest API (5 years hands-on experience) Test Automation in Agile env (5 years hands-on experience) DevOps (CICD) (5 years hands-on experience) AWS Env (3 years hands-on experience) Additional Information This contract-to-hire role can work remotely anywhere within the U.S. Due to the nature of projects supported, this role will require U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Residency (Green Card). This role will pay between $50-$60 per hour W2 during the contract duration and $115,000 per year upon permanent/ full time conversion.
